Post-Match Reflections: Patrick Mabedi, the Flames’ coach, expressed his delight at the win and commended the players for their 'excellent performance'. He added that 'it has always been difficult for Malawi to win, especially in West Africa, so today we have ended that jinx and I am very happy'.
Coach Mabedi dropped a prominent forward player, Frank Gabadinho Mhango, from the squad due to 'discipline reasons'.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The match took place at Samuel Kanyon Doe Sports Stadium in Liberia’s capital, Monrovia.
The Flames are set to host Tunisia on Tuesday, November 21, 2023, at the Bingu National Stadium in Lilongwe for the second game of Group H.
